citation.article-title: Phycicoccus aerophilus sp. nov., isolated from air.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Phycicoccus aerophilus sp. nov.
Phycicoccus aerophilus (ae.ro.phi′lus. Gr. n. aer air; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. masc. adj. aerophilus air-loving).
Cells are strictly aerobic, Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, short rods (0.8–0.9×1.1–1.5 μm).
Colonies are white, round and convex with clear margins on R2A medium.
Growth is observed at 5–37 °C (optimally at 30 °C), pH 5–9 (optimally at pH 6–7) and 0–7 % NaCl (w/v).
Hydrolyses casein, starch, Tween 80, tyrosine and xanthine, but does not hydrolyse chitin, CM-cellulose, hypoxanthine or pectin.

Positive for hydrolysis of aesculin and gelatin and for β-galactosidase, but negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase and urease (API 20NE test strip).

Assimilates d-glucose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, potassium gluconate, malic acid, sucrose, sodium acetate, glycogen, salicin, melibiose, l-fucose, propionic acid, valeric acid and 3-hydroxybutyric acid.

Does not assimilate l-arabinose, capric acid, adipic acid, trisodium citrate, phenylacetic acid, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, inositol, itaconic acid, suberic acid, sodium malonate, lactic acid, potassium 5-ketogluconate, 3-hydroxybenzoic acid, d-sorbitol, l-histidine, potassium 2-ketogluconate, 4-hydroxybenzoic acid or l-proline (API 20NE and API ID 32GN test strips).
The diagnostic cell-wall diamino acid is meso-diaminopimelic acid and the peptidoglycan type is A1γ.
The whole-cell sugars are glucose and ribose.
The polar lipids comprise phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylinositol and diphosphatidylglycerol.
The predominant fatty acids are C17 : 1ω8c, iso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0 and C17 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 70.5 mol%.
The type strain, 5516T-20T (=KACC 20658T =DSM 18548T), was isolated from air sampled in Taean, Republic of Korea.
